result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Dissuade Reporting [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.44(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: (CONSECUTIVE to count 3 and count 1 on case 2015CF467), with credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  --- cash bail to apply.
Court waived the victim witness and  DV surcharge (for financial reasons).
Restitution is set at zero.

No firearms; weapons.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
No contact with victim, Dequincy M. III, without approval of the agent.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending review on 8-14-2015 at 1:30 PM.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in court PRO SE.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT #2, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #3: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count 3 and count 1 on case 2015CF467), in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT #3: Defendant sentenced to serve 4 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count 1 and count 1 on case 2015CF467), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Dequincy M. III, 
   without approval of the agent.    
* Obtain and maintain employment,
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- cash bail to apply.
   Court waived the victim witness and 
   DV surcharge (for financial reasons).
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-14-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld

Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Intimidate Victim / Dissuade Reporting and Domestic Abuse Assessments, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.44(1) and 973.055(1), a Class A Misdemeanor."    mld

Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-27-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in court with attorney Brian C. Hagner.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin 
with Katie Seelow (under the student practice rule).  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense Motion to Dismiss Count #3 (originally dismissed before the initial appearance), is heard and denied by the Court.  Original Information with all (3) three counts, filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial:  Cases 2014CM4254 and 2015CF467.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 3-16-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4 on case 2014CM4254.  Court ordered case 2014CM4254 and 2015CF467 adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-16-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continuedd, until further order of the Court.   mld

15RM004021  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-29-2015
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: DEQUINCY M. III
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  
Defendant Nicole Antoinette Prude in custody.  
Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. 
Defense moves to dismiss Count 2 due to lack of probable cause. Arguments heard. Court Grants defense motion.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 3 ( Misdemeanor).
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
